an7.51:1.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you an exposition of the teaching on the bound and the unbound.
an7.51:1.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak. …
an7.51:1.3: And what is the exposition of the teaching on the bound and the unbound?
an7.51:2.1: A woman focuses on her own femininity:
an7.51:2.2: her feminine moves, feminine appearance, feminine ways, feminine desires, feminine voice, and feminine adornment.
an7.51:2.3: She’s stimulated by this and takes pleasure in it.
an7.51:2.4: So she focuses on the masculinity of others:
an7.51:2.5: masculine moves, masculine appearance, masculine ways, masculine desires, masculine voice, and masculine adornment.
an7.51:2.6: She’s stimulated by this and takes pleasure in it.
an7.51:2.7: So she desires to bond with another.
an7.51:2.8: And she desires the pleasure and happiness that comes from such a bond.
an7.51:2.9: Sentient beings who are attached to their femininity are bound to men.
an7.51:2.10: This is how a woman does not transcend her femininity.
an7.51:3.1: A man focuses on his own masculinity:
an7.51:3.2: his masculine moves, masculine appearance, masculine ways, masculine desires, masculine voice, and masculine adornment.
an7.51:3.3: He’s stimulated by this and takes pleasure in it.
an7.51:3.4: So he focuses on the femininity of others:
an7.51:3.5: feminine moves, feminine appearance, feminine ways, feminine desires, feminine voice, and feminine adornment.
an7.51:3.6: He’s stimulated by this and takes pleasure in it.
an7.51:3.7: So he desires to bond with another.
an7.51:3.8: And he desires the pleasure and happiness that comes from such a bond.
an7.51:3.9: Sentient beings who are attached to their masculinity are bound to women.
an7.51:3.10: This is how a man does not transcend his masculinity.
an7.51:3.11: This is how one is bound.
an7.51:4.1: And how does one become unbound?
an7.51:4.2: A woman doesn’t focus on her own femininity:
an7.51:4.3: her feminine moves, feminine appearance, feminine ways, feminine desires, feminine voice, and feminine adornment.
an7.51:4.4: She isn’t stimulated by this and takes no pleasure in it.
an7.51:4.5: So she doesn’t focus on the masculinity of others:
an7.51:4.6: masculine moves, masculine appearance, masculine ways, masculine desires, masculine voice, and masculine adornment.
an7.51:4.7: She isn’t stimulated by this and takes no pleasure in it.
an7.51:4.8: So she doesn’t desire to bond with another.
an7.51:4.9: Nor does she desire the pleasure and happiness that comes from such a bond.
an7.51:4.10: Sentient beings who are not attached to their femininity are not bound to men.
an7.51:4.11: This is how a woman transcends her femininity.
an7.51:5.1: A man doesn’t focus on his own masculinity:
an7.51:5.2: masculine moves, masculine appearance, masculine ways, masculine desires, masculine voice, and masculine adornment.
an7.51:5.3: He isn’t stimulated by this and takes no pleasure in it.
an7.51:5.4: So he doesn’t focus on the femininity of others:
an7.51:5.5: feminine moves, feminine appearance, feminine ways, feminine desires, feminine voice, and feminine adornment.
an7.51:5.6: He isn’t stimulated by this and takes no pleasure in it.
an7.51:5.7: So he doesn’t desire to bond with another.
an7.51:5.8: Nor does he desire the pleasure and happiness that comes from such a bond.
an7.51:5.9: Sentient beings who are not attached to their masculinity are not bound to women.
an7.51:5.10: This is how a man transcends his masculinity.
an7.51:5.11: This is how one is unbound.
an7.51:5.12: This is the exposition of the teaching on the bound and the unbound.”
